verses.verse: Hear <S%H8085><s%> you the word <S%H1697><s%> which <S%H834><s%> the LORD <S%H3068><s%> speaks <S%H1696><s%> to you, O house <S%H1004><s%> of Israel: <S%H3478><s%>

Thus <S%H3541><s%> said <S%H559><s%> the LORD, <S%H3068><s%> Learn <S%H3925><s%> not the way <S%H1870><s%> of the heathen, <S%H1471><s%> and be not dismayed <S%H2865><s%> at the signs <S%H226><s%> of heaven; <S%H8064><s%> for the heathen <S%H1471><s%> are dismayed <S%H2865><s%> at them.

For the customs <S%H2708><s%> of the people <S%H5971><s%> are vain: <S%H1892><s%> for one cuts <S%H3772><s%> a tree <S%H6086><s%> out of the forest, <S%H3293><s%> the work <S%H4639><s%> of the hands <S%H3027><s%> of the workman, <S%H2796><s%> with the ax. <S%H4621><s%>
They deck <S%H3302><s%> it with silver <S%H3701><s%> and with gold; <S%H2091><s%> they fasten <S%H2388><s%> it with nails <S%H4548><s%> and with hammers, <S%H4717><s%> that it move <S%H6328><s%> not.

They are upright <S%H4749><s%> as the palm <S%H8560><s%> tree, but speak <S%H1696><s%> not: they must needs be borne, <S%H5375><s%> because <S%H3588><s%> they cannot <S%H3808><s%> go. <S%H6805><s%> Be not afraid <S%H3372><s%> of them; for they cannot <S%H3808><s%> do evil, <S%H7489><s%> neither <S%H1571><s%> <S%H369><s%> also <S%H1571><s%> is it in them to do good. <S%H3190><s%>
For as much as there is none <S%H369><s%> like <S%H3644><s%> to you, O LORD; <S%H3068><s%> you are great, <S%H1419><s%> and your name <S%H8034><s%> is great <S%H1419><s%> in might. <S%H1369><s%>

Who <S%H4310><s%> would not fear <S%H3372><s%> you, O King <S%H4428><s%> of nations? <S%H1471><s%> for to you does it appertain: <S%H2969><s%> for as much as among all <S%H3605><s%> the wise <S%H2450><s%> men of the nations, <S%H1471><s%> and in all <S%H3605><s%> their kingdoms, <S%H4467><s%> there is none <S%H369><s%> like <S%H3644><s%> to you.
But they are altogether <S%H259><s%> brutish <S%H1197><s%> and foolish: <S%H3688><s%> the stock <S%H6086><s%> is a doctrine <S%H4148><s%> of vanities. <S%H1892><s%>

Silver <S%H3701><s%> spread <S%H7554><s%> into plates is brought <S%H935><s%> from Tarshish, <S%H8659><s%> and gold <S%H2091><s%> from Uphaz, <S%H210><s%> the work <S%H4639><s%> of the workman, <S%H2796><s%> and of the hands <S%H3027><s%> of the founder: <S%H6884><s%> blue <S%H8504><s%> and purple <S%H713><s%> is their clothing: <S%H3830><s%> they are all <S%H3605><s%> the work <S%H4639><s%> of cunning <S%H2450><s%> men.

But the LORD <S%H3068><s%> is the true <S%H571><s%> God, <S%H430><s%> he is the living <S%H2416><s%> God, <S%H430><s%> and an everlasting <S%H5769><s%> king: <S%H4428><s%> at his wrath <S%H7110><s%> the earth <S%H776><s%> shall tremble, <S%H7493><s%> and the nations <S%H1471><s%> shall not be able <S%H3201><s%> to abide <S%H3557><s%> his indignation. <S%H2195><s%>

Thus <S%H1836><s%> shall you say <S%H560><s%> to them, The gods <S%H426><s%> that have not made <S%H5648><s%> the heavens <S%H8065><s%> and the earth, <S%H778><s%> even they shall perish <S%H7><s%> from the earth, <S%H772><s%> and from under <S%H8460><s%> these <S%H429><s%> heavens. <S%H8065><s%>

He has made <S%H6213><s%> the earth <S%H776><s%> by his power, <S%H3581><s%> he has established <S%H3559><s%> the world <S%H8398><s%> by his wisdom, <S%H2451><s%> and has stretched <S%H5186><s%> out the heavens <S%H8064><s%> by his discretion. <S%H8394><s%>

When he utters <S%H5414><s%> his voice, <S%H6963><s%> there is a multitude <S%H1995><s%> of waters <S%H4325><s%> in the heavens, <S%H8064><s%> and he causes the vapors <S%H5387><s%> to ascend <S%H5927><s%> from the ends <S%H7097><s%> of the earth; <S%H776><s%> he makes <S%H6213><s%> lightning <S%H1300><s%> with rain, <S%H4306><s%> and brings <S%H3318><s%> forth <S%H3318><s%> the wind <S%H7307><s%> out of his treasures. <S%H214><s%>

Every <S%H3605><s%> man <S%H120><s%> is brutish <S%H1197><s%> in his knowledge: <S%H1847><s%> every <S%H3605><s%> founder <S%H6884><s%> is confounded <S%H3001><s%> by the graven <S%H6459><s%> image: <S%H6459><s%> for his molten <S%H5262><s%> image is falsehood, <S%H8267><s%> and there is no <S%H3808><s%> breath <S%H7307><s%> in them.
They are vanity, <S%H1892><s%> and the work <S%H4639><s%> of errors: <S%H8595><s%> in the time <S%H6256><s%> of their visitation <S%H6486><s%> they shall perish. <S%H6><s%>

The portion <S%H2506><s%> of Jacob <S%H3290><s%> is not like them: for he is the former <S%H3335><s%> of all <S%H3605><s%> things; and Israel <S%H3478><s%> is the rod <S%H7626><s%> of his inheritance: <S%H5159><s%> The LORD <S%H3068><s%> of hosts <S%H6635><s%> is his name. <S%H8034><s%>
Gather <S%H622><s%> up your wares <S%H3666><s%> out of the land, <S%H776><s%> O inhabitant <S%H3427><s%> of the fortress. <S%H4693><s%>

For thus <S%H3541><s%> said <S%H559><s%> the LORD, <S%H3068><s%> Behold, <S%H2005><s%> I will sling <S%H7049><s%> out the inhabitants <S%H3427><s%> of the land <S%H776><s%> at this <S%H2063><s%> once, <S%H6471><s%> and will distress <S%H6887><s%> them, that they may find <S%H4672><s%> it so.

Woe <S%H188><s%> is me for my hurt! <S%H7667><s%> my wound <S%H4347><s%> is grievous; <S%H2470><s%> but I said, <S%H559><s%> Truly <S%H389><s%> this <S%H2088><s%> is a grief, <S%H2483><s%> and I must bear <S%H5375><s%> it.

My tabernacle <S%H168><s%> is spoiled, <S%H7703><s%> and all <S%H3605><s%> my cords <S%H4340><s%> are broken: <S%H5423><s%> my children <S%H1121><s%> are gone <S%H3318><s%> forth <S%H3318><s%> of me, and they are not: there is none <S%H369><s%> to stretch <S%H5186><s%> forth my tent <S%H168><s%> any more, <S%H5750><s%> and to set <S%H6965><s%> up my curtains. <S%H3407><s%>

For the pastors <S%H7462><s%> are become <S%H1197><s%> brutish, <S%H1197><s%> and have not sought <S%H1875><s%> the LORD: <S%H3068><s%> therefore <S%H5921><s%> <S%H3651><s%> they shall not prosper, <S%H7919><s%> and all <S%H3605><s%> their flocks <S%H4830><s%> shall be scattered. <S%H6327><s%>

Behold, <S%H2009><s%> the noise <S%H6963><s%> of the bruit <S%H8052><s%> is come, <S%H935><s%> and a great <S%H1419><s%> commotion <S%H7494><s%> out of the north <S%H6828><s%> country, <S%H776><s%> to make <S%H7760><s%> the cities <S%H5892><s%> of Judah <S%H3063><s%> desolate, <S%H8077><s%> and a den <S%H4583><s%> of dragons. <S%H8577><s%>
O LORD, <S%H3068><s%> I know <S%H3045><s%> that the way <S%H1870><s%> of man <S%H120><s%> is not in himself: it is not in man that walks <S%H1980><s%> to direct <S%H3559><s%> his steps. <S%H6806><s%>
O LORD, <S%H3068><s%> correct <S%H3256><s%> me, but with judgment; <S%H4941><s%> not in your anger, <S%H639><s%> lest <S%H6435><s%> you bring me to nothing. <S%H4591><s%>

Pour <S%H8210><s%> out your fury <S%H2534><s%> on the heathen <S%H1471><s%> that know <S%H3045><s%> you not, and on the families <S%H4940><s%> that call <S%H7121><s%> not on your name: <S%H8034><s%> for they have eaten <S%H398><s%> up Jacob, <S%H3290><s%> and devoured <S%H398><s%> him, and consumed <S%H3615><s%> him, and have made <S%H6213><s%> his habitation <S%H5116><s%> desolate. <S%H8074><s%>
